context.introduction: Master the fundamental cooking techniques of Japanese cuisine. Learn about tempura, steaming, and the importance of precise preparation.

sections.title: Tempura: Light and Crispy Frying
sections.content: Tempura is a technique of frying ingredients in a light batter at the right temperature for a crispy texture.

sections.title: Steaming: Gentle Cooking
sections.content: Steaming is used for dishes like chawanmushi, preserving delicate flavors and textures.

sections.title: Knife Skills
sections.content: Proper knife techniques ensure even cooking and beautiful presentation.

sections.title: Oil Temperature
sections.content: For tempura, oil should be kept at 170-180°C (340-355°F) for best results.

sections.title: Technique Tips
listItems: Mix tempura batter lightly and keep it cold
Test oil temperature with a drop of batter
Use fresh ingredients for best flavor
Practice makes perfect for knife skills
